intro: Catolobus ligulifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf catolobus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
